sentences.english: I am honoured to have had the opportunity to see a Lynx up close and personal.
sentences.chinese: 可是我很榮幸地能夠有機會近距離看到這個猞猁。

sentences.english: Lynxes are known for the black tufts of fur on the tips of their ears.
sentences.chinese: 猞猁最明顯的特性是它們耳朵尖上的一撮毛毛。

sentences.english: Lynx is a nationally protected animal.
sentences.chinese: 猞猁是國家二級保護動物。

sentences.english: So Lynx went around to the other side of the lake and turned into a deer.
sentences.chinese: 於是猞猁跑到湖的另一邊變成了鹿的模樣。

sentences.english: An encounter with an elusive Canada Lynx is said to be a rare privelege.
sentences.chinese: 據說能遇到難以捉摸的加拿大猞猁是少有的機會。

sentences.english: When Americans say wildcat, they usually mean a lynx, an ocelot or a bobcat.
sentences.chinese: 美國人說到野貓，他們通常指的是猞猁。

sentences.english: The task of the transplanted lynx is to survive and multiply.
sentences.chinese: 胚胎移植猞猁的目的是讓該物種生存並繁衍。

sentences.english: But forget that for the pumas and lynx at the Queens Zoo.
sentences.chinese: 而皇后動物園的美洲獅和猞猁卻完全不喫這一套。

definition: (bird species of China) golden eagle (Aquila chrysaetos)
wolverine (Gulo gulo), also named 貂熊[diao1 xiong2]
vulture/(bird species of China) griffon vulture (Gyps fulvus)
